tit.cmt: カッコ部分を補いました。

sen.j: 五畿七道（ごきしちどう）とは、古代日本の律令制における、広域地方行政区画である。
sen.e: Gokishichido was a name for the broadly local administrative units under the ritsuryo system in ancient Japan.
Gokishichido was a name for the broader-based local administrative districts under the ritsuryo system in ancient Japan.
Gokishichido was a name for the broader-based local administrative districts under the ritsuryo system in ancient Japan.

sen.j: 畿内七道（きないしちどう）とも呼ばれた。
sen.e: It was also called kinaishichido.
It was also called kinaishichido.
It was also called kinaishichido.

sen.j: 北海道が置かれてからは五畿八道と呼ばれる。
sen.e: Including Hokkaido, it was called gokihachido.
Including Hokkaido, it was called gokihachido.
Including Hokkaido, it was called gokihachido.

sen.j: 元々は、中国で用いられていた行政区分「道」に倣った物である。
sen.e: It borrowed from "do," administrative units, which were originally used in China.
sen.cmt: 「(行政区画)中国」を削除しました。
sen.e: It copied 'do,' administrative divisions, which were originally used in China.
sen.cmt: borrowed from→copied,units→divisions クォーツを週背しました。
sen.e: It copied 'do,' administrative divisions, which were originally used in China.

sen.j: 日本における「道」の成立については大化の改新以前より存在したとする見方もあるが、五畿七道の原型は天武天皇の時代に成立したと言われている。
sen.e: "Do" apparently came into existence in Japan before the Taika Reform while the archetype of gokishichido was organized in the time of Emperor Tenmu.
Do' apparently came into existence in Japan before the Taika Reform while the archetype of gokishichido was organized in the time of Emperor Tenmu.
sen.cmt: クォーツを修正しました。
sen.e: Do' apparently came into existence in Japan before the Taika Reform while the archetype of gokishichido was organized in the time of Emperor Tenmu.

sen.j: 当初は全国を、都（平城京・平安京）周辺を畿内五国、それ以外の地域をそれぞれ七道に区分した。
sen.e: At first, it consisted of five provinces in the Kinai, around the capital (Heijokyo or Heiankyo), and seven do in the other areas of Japan.
At first, it consisted of five provinces in the Kinai, around the capital (Heijokyo or Heiankyo), and seven do in the other areas of Japan.
At first, it consisted of five provinces in the Kinai, around the capital (Heijokyo or Heiankyo), and seven do in the other areas of Japan.

sen.j: 律令時代からの七道は、概ね地形的要件に基づいて区分されているが、西海道以外では道単位での行政機関は常置されなかった。
sen.e: The seven do since the Ritsuryo period were generally distributed based on geographical conditions, but an administrative agency as a do unit was not set other thatn in Saikaido.
The seven do since the Ritsuryo period were generally distributed based on their geographical conditions, but no administrative agency as a do unit was set other than in Saikaido.
sen.cmt: their を補いました。文後半、流れをスムースに修正しました。thatn→than と修正しました。
sen.e: The seven do since the Ritsuryo period were generally distributed based on their geographical conditions, but no administrative agency as a do unit was set other than in Saikaido.

sen.j: 西海道は大陸との外交・防衛上の重要性から大宰府が置かれて諸国を管轄した。
sen.e: The Saikaido was so important to diplomacy with and security against the continent that Dazaifu was located there to administrate provinces.
The Saikaido was so important to diplomacy with and security against the continent that Dazaifu was located there to control provinces.
The Saikaido was so important to diplomacy with and security against the continent that Dazaifu was located there to control provinces.

sen.j: 七道の各国の国府は、それぞれ同じ名の幹線官道で結ばれていた。
sen.e: A kokufu in each province of the shichido was connected with other kokufu by road, and each road had the same name as the shichido.
Kokufu in each province of the shichido were connected with other kokufu by roads, and each road had the same name as the shichido.
sen.cmt: A kokufu→Kokufu,road→roads,was→were と修正しました。
sen.e: Kokufu in each province of the shichido were connected with other kokufu by roads, and each road had the same name as the shichido.

sen.j: 七道は大路、中路、小路に分けられ、備える馬の数が異なっていた。
sen.e: The shichido were divided into oji, nakaji and koji based on the number of horses equipped.
The shichido were divided into dairo, churo and shoro and the number of horses equipped differed from each other.
sen.cmt: 「大路＝だいろ」「中路＝ちゅうろ」「小路＝しょうろ」と読み方をそれぞれ確認し、修正しました。文脈より修正しました。
sen.e: The shichido were divided into dairo, churo and shoro and the number of horses equipped differed from each other.

sen.j: これら七道には、江戸時代の五街道などと重複する呼称がある。
sen.e: Some of the shichido had the same names as the gokaido in the Edo period.
Some of the shichido had the same names as the gokaido in the Edo period.
Some of the shichido had the same names as the gokaido in the Edo period.

sen.j: 時代や成り立ちが異なるものの、ほぼ同じ道筋にはなっている。
sen.e: They followed the same routes although the scheme and the time of construction were different.
They followed almost the same routes although the time and the way they came about were different.
sen.cmt: almost を補いました。文脈より修正しました。
sen.e: They followed almost the same routes although the time and the way they came about were different.

sen.j: その後、細部の境界の移動を除き長らく変更はなかったが、後に、和人地および蝦夷地に新たに北海道 (令制)が置かれた。
sen.e: Then, they did not change long although some boundaries shifted a little bit, and later Hokkaido (unit) was newly set in Wajinchi and Ezochi.
Then, they did not make any changes for long time except some boundaries shifted a little bit, and later Hokkaido (as province) was newly set in Wajinchi and Ezochi.
sen.cmt: 文脈より修正しました。カッコ内を修正しました。（令制）については、”令制国における名称”と理解し、修正しました。
sen.e: Then, they did not make any changes for long time except some boundaries shifted a little bit, and later Hokkaido (as province) was newly set in Wajinchi and Ezochi.

sen.j: 以後、五畿八道と呼ぶ。
sen.e: After that, it was called gokihachido.
After that, it was called gokihachido.
After that, it was called gokihachido.

sen.j: なお、北海道の記録は古く斉明天皇の時代阿倍比羅夫の遠征まで遡り、鎌倉時代には大和民族が住み道南十二館の時代を経、江戸時代には松前藩領や天領となっていた地域に最後に置かれた。
sen.e: A record of Hokkaido could date back to the expedition by ABE no Hirafu in the time of Emperor Saimei, and the Yamato race lived there during the Kamakura period, and after the time of Donanjunitate, Hokkaido was located in the Matsumae domain and the Imperial manor in the Edo period.
sen.cmt: 「皇極・斉明天皇の年譜の」を削除しました。
sen.e: A record of Hokkaido could date back to the expedition by ABE no Hirafu in the time of Emperor Saimei, and the Yamato race lived there during the Kamakura period, and after the time of Donanjunitate, Hokkaido was finally located in where the Matsumae Domain and the Imperial manor had been in the Edo period.
sen.cmt: finally, where, had been を補いました。domain→Domain と修正しました。
sen.e: A record of Hokkaido could date back to the expedition by ABE no Hirafu in the time of Emperor Saimei, and the Yamato race lived there during the Kamakura period, and after the time of Donanjunitate, Hokkaido was finally located in where the Matsumae Domain and the Imperial manor had been in the Edo period.

sen.j: これは律令時代から置かれた他の七道と比べると、薩摩藩の付庸国時代を経て令制国となった琉球王国（沖縄）とともにずっと後世の行政区分である。
sen.e: Compared to the shichido which were set in the Ritsuryo period, this unit was set long afterward along with the Kingdom of Ryukyu which became a unit after the time of subordination to the Satsuma domain.

Compared to the other shichido which were set in the Ritsuryo period, this administrative division was set much later along with the Kingdom of Ryukyu (Okinawa) which became a province after the time of subordination to the Satsuma domain.
sen.cmt: other, カッコ部分を補いました。unit→administrative division,long afterward→much later,a unit→a province,domain→Domain と修正しました。
sen.e: Compared to the other shichido which were set in the Ritsuryo period, this administrative division was set much later along with the Kingdom of Ryukyu (Okinawa) which became a province after the time of subordination to the Satsuma domain.

sen.j: 畿内
sen.e: Kinai
Kinai
Kinai

sen.j: 東海道 中路
sen.e: Tokaido nakaji
Tokaido churo
Tokaido churo

sen.j: 東山道 中路
sen.e: Tosando nakaji
Tosando churo
Tosando churo

sen.j: 北陸道 小路
sen.e: Hokurikudo koji
Hokurikudo shoro
Hokurikudo shoro

sen.j: 山陰道 小路
sen.e: San'indo koji
Sanindo shoro
Sanindo shoro

sen.j: 山陽道 大路
sen.e: San'yodo oji
Sanyodo dairo
Sanyodo dairo

sen.j: 南海道 小路
sen.e: Nankaido koji
Nankaido shoro
Nankaido shoro

sen.j: 西海道 小路
sen.e: Saikaido koji
Saikaido shoro
Saikaido shoro

sen.j: 北海道 (令制)
sen.e: Hokkaido (unit)
Hokkaido (as province)
sen.cmt: カッコ内を修正しました。
sen.e: Hokkaido (as province)

sen.j: 1871年の廃藩置県以降も五畿八道は廃止されておらず令制国も併用されていたが、1885年よりも後になると廃れ現在は五畿七道としての地方区分はあまり用いられなくなっている。
sen.e: After the abolition of han system in 1871, the gokihachido and the units were not abolished, but they died out after 1885 and the local administrative units as gokishichido are not used.

After the Haihan-chiken (abolition of feudal domains and establishment of prefectures) in 1871, the gokihachido and the provinces were not abolished, but they died out after 1885 and the local administrative divisions as gokishichido have not been much used.
sen.cmt: 「廃藩置県」を修正しました。units→provinces,units→divisions,are not used→have not been much used と修正しました。
sen.e: After the Haihan-chiken (abolition of feudal domains and establishment of prefectures) in 1871, the gokihachido and the provinces were not abolished, but they died out after 1885 and the local administrative divisions as gokishichido have not been much used.

sen.j: しかし、現在の日本各地の地方名の多く（北陸地方、山陽地方、山陰地方、北海道など）は、五畿七道に由来している。
sen.e: However, many local district names around Japan (Hokuriku District, San'yo District, San'in District and Hokkaido) originate from the gokishichido.
However, today's many local region names around Japan (Hokuriku region, Sanyo region, Sanin region and Hokkaido) originate from the gokishichido.
sen.cmt: today's を補いました。District→region,San'yo→Sanyo,San'in→Sanin と修正しました。
sen.e: However, today's many local region names around Japan (Hokuriku region, Sanyo region, Sanin region and Hokkaido) originate from the gokishichido.

sen.j: また、東海道新幹線や山陽新幹線、北陸自動車道などの交通網や、今後想定される東海地震や南海地震などの名称にもその名残が見られる。
sen.e: Names of transportation network such as the Tokaido Shinkansen, the San'yo Shinkansen, and the Hokuriku Expressway, and names of envisaged earthquake such as the Tokai Earthquake and the Nankai Earthquake have a vestige of the gokishichido.

Names of transportation networks such as the Tokaido Shinkansen, the Sanyo Shinkansen, and the Hokuriku Expressway, and names of predicted earthquakes such as the Tokai Earthquake and the Nankai Earthquake have the vestiges of the gokishichido.
sen.cmt: network→networks,San'yo→Sanyo,envisaged→predicted,earthquake→earthquakes,a vestige→the vestiges,スペースを修正しました。
sen.e: Names of transportation networks such as the Tokaido Shinkansen, the Sanyo Shinkansen, and the Hokuriku Expressway, and names of predicted earthquakes such as the Tokai Earthquake and the Nankai Earthquake have the vestiges of the gokishichido.
